Audio Description: In the center of the pale blue background of this poster about food conservation is a young, wide-eyed woman with dark brown hair. She is wearing a white apron, with cherries printed on it, over a yellow short-sleeved dress with a windowpane check pattern. In her arms she is holding three glass jars, the two on the left have gold metal lids and one on the right has a glass lid and wire bale. The jar on the left is filled with a red fruit or vegetable, the middle jar is filled with green beans, and the jar on the right is filled with orange carrots. In the foreground of the poster are three more glass jars the two on the left with gray metal lids and the one on the right with a glass lid and wire bale. The left jar is filled with red beets, the middle jar is filled with a red fruit and the one on the right is filled with yellow corn. At the top of the poster in large red letters are the word Am I Proud and at the bottom of the poster in smaller black letters are the words I’m fighting famine…by canning food at home.
Creator: United States. Department of Agriculture
Description: Poster, 66 x 47 cm, artist: Dick Williams
